org.safs.install

Class ProductDetectorDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.install.ProductDetectorDefault
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IProductDetector

    public class ProductDetectorDefault
extends java.lang.Object
implements IProductDetector
    This class ONLY provides implementation for
    • getBins()
    • getValidExecutable(File, String)
    User NEEDS to implement the other methods to get it work.
    Author:
    Lei Wang

        public InstallerImpl.BIT_OPTION getProductBit()
        Specified by:
        getProductBit in interface IProductDetector
        Returns:
        BIT_OPTION, the bit (32 or 64) of the product to detect.

      • setProductBit

        public void setProductBit(InstallerImpl.BIT_OPTION productBit)
        Specified by:
        setProductBit in interface IProductDetector

      • getRegistryValue

        public java.lang.String getRegistryValue(java.lang.String keyPrefix,
                                         java.lang.String keySuffix,
                                         java.lang.String value)
        To get the value from registry for path starting with #HKLM_ST
        According to product bit productBit, get the registry's value.
        Parameters:
        keyPrefix - String, the prefix of the registry path, such as 'HKLM\Software\'.
        keySuffix - String, the suffix of the registry path, such as 'GPL Ghostscript\9.23'
        value - String, the registry value, it can be "(Default)".
        Returns:
        String the value got from registry

      • deleteRegistry

        public boolean deleteRegistry(java.lang.String keyPrefix,
                              java.lang.String keySuffix,
                              java.lang.String value)
        To delete the value from registry for path starting with #HKLM_ST
        According to product bit productBit, delete the registry's value.
        Parameters:
        keyPrefix - String, the prefix of the registry path, such as 'HKLM\Software\'.
        keySuffix - String, the suffix of the registry path, such as 'GPL Ghostscript\9.23'
        value - String, the registry value, it can be "(Default)".
        Returns:
        boolean true if the registry value has been successfully deleted.

      • getHomes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getHomes()
        Return an empty Map.
        Specified by:
        getHomes in interface IProductDetector
        Returns:
        Map, a map containing pairs of (key, product_installation_full_path).
        an empty map if non installation has been detected.

      • getPreferredHome

        public java.lang.String getPreferredHome()
        Return null.
        Specified by:
        getPreferredHome in interface IProductDetector
        Returns:
        String, the preferred product_installation_full_path if multiple products have been installed.
        null if non product installation is detected.

        public java.lang.String getDefaultHome()
        Return null.
        Specified by:
        getDefaultHome in interface IProductDetector
        Returns:
        String, the default home directory to install the product

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        home - String, the product's home directory
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if not found

      • getBins

        public java.lang.String[] getBins()
        Return an array containing one sub folder 'bin'.
        Specified by:
        getBins in interface IProductDetector
        Returns:
        String[], an array of sub folder (relative to the product home) holding executables. An empty array if there is no possible value.

      • getPossibleExecutables

        public java.lang.String[] getPossibleExecutables()
        Return an empty String array.
        Specified by:
        getPossibleExecutables in interface IProductDetector
        Returns:
        String[], an array of "relative path" for possible executables (relative to the product home).
        The first element is the most favorable; the last the least favorable.
        An empty array if no executable is possible.

      • getValidExecutable

        public java.io.File getValidExecutable(java.io.File home,
                                       java.lang.String defaultExecutable)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Implement the search logic suggested in the interface.
        1. find the default executable under product home
        2. find the default executable under the getBins() sub folder of product home
        3. find the getPossibleExecutables() under the product home
        Specified by:
        getValidExecutable in interface IProductDetector
        Parameters:
        home - File, the product home directory
        defaultExecutable - String, the default executable. It could be name or "path relative to home".
        Returns:
        File, the valid executable
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if no executable could be found
        See Also:
        ProductDetectorDefault
